Article text or name. The text will appear on all standard offer templates, standard order confirmations, etc. You can alter the text in SalesOffice. The change will not be updated on the article in the economy system
Free text concerning the packaging. You could, for example, specify how many units this packaging consists of compared with the previous packaging size

Here you specify the article's PLU number

Here you specify the weight of the package. Information is exported to the offer line when registering an offer. The weight can be altered for the article in SalesOffice but it will not be updated for the article in the economy system

This field specifies the path for Visma Rubicon data. If you want to browse to the location, use the Find button. Here you must use the same path that the client has in Visma Rubicon. This means, for example, that if you use \\Server1\data as the data path for the relevant client in Visma Rubicon, you must also have \\Server1\data as the data path in the setup for the integration:15511511;

In the customer interval you enter the number series used for customers in Visma Rubicon. Depending on the number of digits you have in the ledger, the numbers here will mean different intervals. E.g. If you have a 5-digit ledger and the number series for customers is 10000 ы 49999, 1 must be entered here:15511520;

In the supplier interval you enter the number series used for suppliers in Visma Rubicon. This depends on the number of digits in the ledger in the same way as the customer interval, see above. E.g. If the number series is -99999, 5 must be entered here
In the common document directory, specify the directory name for saving documents. Use a UNC path for documents, e.g. \\server1\vsodoc. You can specify a directory for each company:15511680;
Here you enter the name of the computer on which the Visma Global server is installed.:15511731;
If you have selected the option for limitation in integration, you specify here the customer number you want the limitation to end at
If you have selected the option for limitation in integration, you specify here the supplier number you want the limitation to start at
If you have selected the option for limitation in integration, you specify here the supplier number you want the limitation to end at

Here you enter the project number that is to be local in Visma SalesOffice; it must be set to be higher than the series that is integrated with the finance system. It can, for example, be set as the same number for local business connections.:15511963;
The client number in Visma Business with which the Visma SalesOffice client is to be integrated. F0193 = Client number 193
The SQL server on which the Visma Business database runs
UserID (name) to be used on the SQL server when logging on. (Use SA user on the SQL server):15511985;

There are many group fields in Visma Business and you can choose groups in Visma Business which will correspond to Customer group in Visma SalesOffice. The parameters are set as the name of the field in Visma Business. You can choose between the following field names: Gr, Gr2, Gr3, G

There are many group fields in Visma Business and you can choose groups in Visma Business which will correspond to Customer type in Visma SalesOffice. The parameters are set as the name of the field in Visma Business. You can choose between the following field names: Gr, Gr2, Gr3, Gr4

Here you can see which organisational unit (R1-R6) which is to be a project in Visma SalesOffice. This parameter is registered when you run SetupVsoLnk and it is not possible to edit in the integration wizard

You must define a language to be used in connection with the integration of all tables with language support in Visma Business. In SalesOffice, customer groups do not for example have a different name depending on the language you are using, but in Visma Business you can define a text for each language.15512416;

The various exchange rates can be registered with up to 6 digits before and 6 digits after the decimal point in accordance with international currency rules numbers decimals for the exchange rate. If decimals are used, the decimal character must be entered

Date and time when the support case overruns the set response time
The date on which the case is published to the knowledgebase
The role that created the case
Field for use by main customers on the Web. You can indicate here that a case has been taken up with the customer and is therefore out of the way15001753;
ForeignKey to BC_ReleaseNotesStatus
The employee who is responsible for the note writing for the support caseForeignKey to BC_Employee
The project that a case is linked toForeignKey to BC_Project
Estimated number of days which will be spent solving a support case
Estimated number of hours which will be spent solving a support case
Percentage completion to indicate how much of a support case has been solved
Remaining number of days on a support case
Remaining number of hours on a support case
Number of hours actually spent on a support case
Number of hours actually spent on a support case
ForeignKey to BC_SupportCase
ForeignKey to BC_Employee
In this field, you enter a new internal comment. After saving, what you enter here will only be seen in the change log:25001013;
Shows the customer' licence number which has been entered for the case
Shows the total accrued support time for the support case
Shows the total invoiced time for the support case
The programs field initially shows only the programs for which the customer has a licence. If you select theShow all programs option, you will be able to register cases for all programs
Shows the name of the person who is caseowner for the support case
Shows the name of the person who last altered the support case
Shows the name of the person who created the support case
If this option is selected, an e-mail will be sent to the caseowner regardless of any other changes which are made and regardless of the caseowner' e-mail settings
If this option is selected, an e-mail will be sent to the customer regardless of any other changes which are made and regardless of the customer' e-mail settings
Shows the delay time for the support case in days, hours and minutes

When the support contract was created

BC_Template (50188).Description: Sequence number for templates which are imported
Shows the number for the template type which is imported. 1 = Word template and 2 = Excel template
Saves the ID of the table that the template type is linked to
Name of the template which is imported
Saves the directory for the location of the templates. The templates which are imported will automatically be copied to the templates directory, e.g. Templates\Standard Lettertemplate.dot

BC_TemplateType (50189).Description: Saves the template type number for the various templates. 1 = Documents, 2 = Calculations, 100 = ConnectedFiles, 101 = Attachments
Saves the directory names which are used for the various activity types. Documents, Calculations, ConnectedFiles and Attachments
Saves the extension for the type of template. *.doc =documents, *.xls = Calculations, .* = ConnectedFiles, .* = Attachments

BC_Titles (50156).Description: Saves information on whether there is a note/picture and whether there is a colour for the title

BC_ToDo (50148).Description: Unique sequence number for the various Todo list tasks
In the Priority field, you can define different priorities. You may need to use statements such as "High", "Low", "Urgent", "Trade Fair", "Friday's meeting" etc.ForeignKey to BC_Priority
Date is the date on which the task becomes due/must be completed. When creating a new task, the date is automatically set to today's date. This can be altered if necessary
The time is the time at which the task becomes due/must be completed
Saves information if a task has been completed. 0=not completed, 1= completed

A task can be linked to a business connection. This can be brought up by placing the focus on the business field, typing in the name or searching for a business connection. Note: To change a business connection which has already been registered, you must press F2 in the business connection fieldForeignKey to BC_Customer
Potential sale which has been registered with the follow-up dateForeignKey to BC_Prospects
Saves the employee number of the person who registered the task of the person who was assigned the taskForeignKey to BC_Employee
The date on which the task was completed
E-mail number which has been linked in and has a follow-up date
The description field is used to enter information on the task
Saves description if the follow-up has been generated from e-mail, potential sales, etc. The text is saved as EMAIL, PROSPECT
Saves the key value for the activity which has follow-up
In the warning start field, you specify how long before the task is due that you want to receive a reminder. This is automatically set to 15 (minutes) but it can be changed if required
Used to provide a link between a Todo list activity in SalesOffice and MS Exchange in connection with MS Outlook integration

Reminder for Todo list activities. A request to receive a reminder from the time manager/Todo list is set for the employee. The message handling works so that if the user has SalesOffice up on the screen, the message will be shown on the screen

BC_TypeOfActivity (50137).Description: Saves information on whether there is a note/picture and whether a colour has been assigned to the activity type

BC_Version (40019).Description: The program that the version is linked toForeignKey to BC_Program
Determines whether the version will only be available for internal users
Determines whether the version is to be available for external users
